meanings.definition: The action of abasing or humbling oneself.
meanings.sent1: His constant abasement in front of others made him feel small.
meanings.sent2: The abasement of the defeated team was evident in their body language.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful abasement in front of its owner was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The abasement of the once proud leader was like watching a mighty tree bend in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The abasement of the character in the movie was a powerful moment of vulnerability.

meanings.definition: The state of being degraded or lowered in rank or dignity.
meanings.sent1: She felt deep abasement after failing the important exam.
meanings.sent2: The abasement of the fallen king was a tragic sight.
meanings.sent3: The abasement of the cake after it fell on the floor was comical.
meanings.sent4: The abasement of the old building showed years of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The abasement of the once grand statue left it barely recognizable.
